title: The Black Rabbit – The Moon Lens

tiles.caption: Target: The Moon Lens
tiles.text: Today's plan is clear: find the Moon Lens. With it, the crystal enlarges the map, and you can search deeper for the route to Kelo-Ketis. The target points to an area with low rocks and tall grass, at the edge of a forest.

tiles.caption: Strange Tracks
tiles.text: Small, zigzag tracks appear in the grass, disappearing near a hollow log. Next to them, carrot tops that have been "artistically tasted."

tiles.caption: The Black Rabbit
tiles.text: A black rabbit with matte fur and big eyes jumps out of the log. "Hello! I am... sometimes here, sometimes on Lunaria. It depends on how you blink," it says, then laughs. "I know where the Lens is. And I need help to get home, to Lunaria. If you help me, I'll show you the way to the Lens."

tiles.caption: The Lens's Location
tiles.text: Guided by the rabbit, you reach a short, cold grotto, with ankle-deep water. Pale crystals hang from the ceiling; on a rock, a translucent disc—the Moon Lens—is caught between two stone growths.

tiles.caption: The Small Problem
tiles.text: When you touch the rock, the water ripples and the entrance seems to "breathe," tightening slightly. "A sensitive grotto," says the rabbit. "Do good, you get an exit. Do wrong, you get a cold shower."

tiles.caption: How to Proceed
tiles.question: Choose the approach to remove the Moon Lens without destabilizing the grotto:

answers.text: You squeeze through the narrow opening and work quickly, so you don't give the walls time to "breathe."
You move slowly, checking your footing with each step, and keep the water as still as possible.
You make a quick plan: who holds the flashlight, who sets the lever, the order of movements, a signal for "stop."
You improvise a tool: a stick with a loop of string to pull the lens from a distance.
First, you set up markers and safe exits: stepping stones, a rope at the entrance, a time limit for retreat.

tiles.caption: Success
tiles.text: The Lens comes out cleanly, without disturbing the grotto. The rabbit claps its paws: "Well done! Sideways is better than straight on!" You place the Lens over the crystal, and the map's image becomes clear. The rabbit looks at you resolutely: "Let's keep in touch. I want to go home, to Lunaria—do you promise to help me?"
